byline.original: By DANIEL VICTOR and JEFFREY GETTLEMAN

abstract: Feyisa Lilesa, Ethiopan silver medalist in Olympic marathon run, defies ban on political demonstrations at games by raising his arms in X as he crosses finish line in gesture of protest against his country's government; Lilesa says his actions have put him in danger should he return home, and he will have to go elsewhere.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Feyisa Lilesa, the Olympic silver medal winner, said his gesture at the finish line in Rio de Janeiro could get him killed if he returned home.
snippet: Feyisa Lilesa, the Olympic silver medal winner, said his gesture at the finish line in Rio de Janeiro could get him killed if he returned home....

headline.main: Ethiopian Marathoner’s Protest Puts Him at Odds With His Government
headline.print_headline: Protest Puts Marathoner in Tight Spot Politically
